DOC.brief_summary: This research study seek identify , understand , overcome barrier use clinical practice guideline pediatric oncology healthcare providers The treatment childhood cancer intense result high rate symptom require support healthcare provider . By review patient ' medical chart record , meet focus group one-on-one interview , healthcare provider may improve clinical practice guideline use support child undergo cancer treatment .
DOC.brief_title: Identifying , Understanding , Overcoming Barriers Use Clinical Practice Guidelines Pediatric Oncology
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To measure rate adherence select Children 's Oncology Group ( COG ) -endorsed supportive care clinical practice guideline ( CPG ) recommendation National Cancer Institute ( NCI ) Community Oncology Research Program ( NCORP ) sit . ( Aim 1 ) II . To describe possible influence NCORP site size number patient enrol COG study per site delivery CPG-consistent care . ( Aim 1a ) III . To describe clinical outcome episodes patient receive CPG-consistent CPG-inconsistent care . ( Aim 1b ) IV . To describe facilitator barrier use CPGs elicit via focus group interview diverse set potential user ( physician , nurse , nurse practitioner pharmacist ) provide pediatric cancer care NCORP sit . ( Aim 2 ) V. To improve well CPG recommendation understand health care provider refine CPG recommendation format base iterative process cognitive interview formatting revision . ( Aim 3 ) OUTLINE : AIM 1 ( MEASURING CPG CONSISTENT CARE ) : Patients separate CPG evaluate ( fever neutropenia [ FN ] , chemotherapy induce nausea vomit [ CINV ] , fertility preservation [ FP ] ) randomly select medical chart review . Patients eligible episode FN , CINV FP within health record select data record abstract review COG adherence COG endorse CPGs . AIM 2 ( FACILITATORS AND BARRIERS TO CPG ADHERENCE ) : Health care provider provide direct care pediatric oncology patient identify separated participate three type focus group : physician-only , non-physician , mixed . AIM 3 ( CPG RECOMMENDATION FORMATTING ) : Health care provider undergo one-on-one interview consist think aloud technique ( TAL ) cognitive interviewing .
DOC.criteria: Willingness participate 3 aim AIM 1 ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA FOR INCLUSION IN RETROSPECTIVE CENTRALIZED CHART REVIEW Received care inpatient outpatient participate COG NCORP site time period January 1 , 2014 December 31 , 2015 Ever enrol COG trial ( episode occur trial COG trial may therapeutic nontherapeutic ) CPGSpecific Eligibility FN Has follow diagnosis : Newly diagnose acute lymphoblastic leukemia Relapsed acute lymphoblastic leukemia Any acute myeloid leukemia Burkitt 's mature B cell nonHodgkin 's lymphoma Any myeloablative autologous allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation CINV Diagnosis cancer Received moderately highly emetogenic chemotherapy inpatient FP Newly diagnose cancer > = 15 year age Note : single patient may contribute data multiple episode AIM 2 AND AIM 3 INCLUSION CRITERIA Healthcare professional currently employ participate institution Eligible healthcare provider include limited : physician , nurse , nurse practitioner , pharmacist , social worker , dietician , psychologist , physiotherapist Provides direct care child cancer part current position NCORP site AIM 2 AND AIM 3 EXCLUSION CRITERIA Trainees exclude Previous participation study either Aim 2 Aim 3
